text: The Danish local elections of 2021 will be held in 2021 for Denmark's 98 municipal councils and five regional councils. All seats were contested for the 2021-25 term of office, together with seats in five regional councils. In the previous election, there were 2,432 seats in the municipal councils. ==Results== ===Results of regional elections=== The regions are not municipalities but are financed only through block grants. ====Number of councillors and political parties in the Regional Councils==== {| class="wikitable" !style="background-color:#E9E9E9"|Party !style="background- color":#E9E9E9"|Seats |align="right" | |- |style="background-color:#E9E9E9" colspan="2"|Total |align="right" style="background-color:#E9E9E9"| |} ====Mayors in the municipalities==== The mayors (Danish:Borgmester; plural:Borgmestre) of the 98 municipalities heads the council meetings and is the chairman of the finance committee in each of their respective municipalities. Only in Copenhagen, this mayor - the head of the finance committee and council meetings - is called the Lord Mayor (Danish:Overborgmester). {| class="wikitable" style="margin- left:1em;" |- | colspan="4" style="background:#dddddd; text-align:center;"| Mayors after the election |- ! colspan="2"|Party ! style="width:60px;"|Number ! style="width:60px;"|Change |- | style="background:#dd0000;"| | style="padding-left:5px;"|Social Democrats | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- | style="background:#9B30FF;"| | style="padding-left:5px;"|Danish Social Liberal Party | style="text- align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- | style="background:#008800;"| | style="padding-left:5px;"|Conservative People's Party | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- | style="background:#FF1493;"| | style="padding-left:5px;"|Socialist People's Party | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- | style="background:#dddd00;"| | style="padding-left:5px;"|Danish People's Party | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- | style="width:20px; background:#0000dd;"| | style="width:200px; padding- left:5px;"|Venstre | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- | style="background:#00ff00;"| | style="padding-left:5px;"|The Alternative | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- | style="background:#8B8989;"| | style="padding-left:5px;"|Local parties | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |} ===Old and new mayors in the municipalities=== The term of office for the mayors elected by the majority of councillors among its members in each municipal council is the same as for the councils elected, namely 1 January 2021 until 31 December 2025.
